intro: Panicum latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf panicgrass, is a perennial grass species native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its wide, flat leaves and panicles of small, spikelet-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its attractive, grass-like appearance. Panicum latifolium plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
